bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 166, Number 18 (Tuesday, January 28, 2020)][House]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mrs. AXNE:H.R. 5688.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:This bill is enacted pursuant to the power granted toCongress under Article I, Section 8, Clause 18 of the UnitedStates Constitution.[Page H633]

item.title: Elijah E. Cummings Lower Drug Costs Now Act

latestAction.text: Read the second time. Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 521.

item.title: Reducing Administrative Costs and Burdens in Health Care Act of 2019

latestAction.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Health, Education, Labor, and Pensions.

item.text: Referred to the House Committee on Energy and Commerce.

item.name: Department of Health and Human Services

summary.text:
Reducing Administrative Costs and Burdens in Health Care Act of 2020

This bill requires the Department of Health and Human Services (HHS) to take a series of actions relating to health care administrative costs. Specifically, HHS must develop a strategy and take associated action to reduce unnecessary costs and administrative burdens in the health care system, including Medicare, Medicaid, and the private health-insurance market, by at least half over a period of 10 years. HHS must also award grants so that states may establish commissions targeting such costs.

bill.title: Reducing Administrative Costs and Burdens in Health Care Act of 2020

item.title: Reducing Administrative Costs and Burdens in Health Care Act of 2020
To amend the Public Health Service Act to provide for grants to enable States to carry out activities to reduce administrative costs and burdens in health care.
Reducing Administrative Costs and Burdens in Health Care Act of 2020

latestAction.text: Referred to the House Committee on Energy and Commerce.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
